DOC.brief_summary: To assess impact lifestylel change upon measure wellness age , particular weight change , fitness measure , cognitive performance . The hypothesis aerobic exercise would improve mental performance measure fitness .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Lifestyle Changes Modifying Practical Markers Wellness Aging .
DOC.detailed_description: A 10-week , randomize control study conduct wellness center St. Petersburg , Florida . Adults age 21-65 , exercise less 3 days/week . 56 subject randomize control intervention group . Subjects follow diet > 30 gram fiber < 16 gram saturate fat daily , taught reach 70-85 % maximum heart rate 5-6 days/week , perform strength train 3 days/week , plus asked participate 10-20 minute stress management activity daily . The study design determine body composition , maximal aerobic capacity ( VO2 max ) , total cholesterol/high-density lipoprotein ( TC/HDL ) , cognition . Specific aspect ofcognitive performance note increase increase level aerobic activity , strength training , dietary fiber change , stress managment . Having establish treatment group would exercise different level intensity , additional subject recruit , cognitive performance exercise , moderate aerobic exercise , frequent aerobic exercise could compare specific domain cognitive performance : memory , psychomotor speed , reaction time , attention , cognitive flexibility . The St Anthony â€™ Institutional Review Board approve research project .
DOC.criteria: able exercise 56 day per week Free major medical condition , unable exercise aerobically 56 day per week
